brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to investigate whether insulin sensitivity and insulin
      resistance of the human brain is comparable in all insulin sensitive parts of the brain and
      whether correlates to other phenotypic information (i.e. whole body insulin sensitivity,
      BMI, age) of the study participants.

clinical_study.brief_title: Insulin Sensitivity of the Human CNS System: fMRI Study With Intranasal Insulin Application

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Normal routine blood works

          -  for women: negative pregnancy test

          -  healthy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Type 2 diabetes

          -  pregnancy

          -  acute or chronic diseases

          -  Pacemakers

          -  Artificial heart valves

          -  Metal prostheses

          -  Implanted magnetic metal parts (screws, ...)

          -  Metal fragments

          -  Braces

          -  insulin pumps

          -  Tattoos

          -  claustrophobia

          -  reduced temperature sensation and / or increased sensitivity to warming of the body

          -  Ear disease or an increased sensitivity to loud noises

clinical_study.official_title: Insulinsensitivität Des Menschlichen Zentralnervensystems: Kernspintomographische Untersuchung Mit Intranasaler Gabe Von Insulin

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

primary_outcome.measure: Insulin effect on regional brain activity assessed by fMRI
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 15 minutes and 60 minutes post spray application

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
